Class Turn

  • java.lang.Object
    • Turn
  • public class Turn
extends java.lang.Object
    The Turn class contains methods that pertain to the user input commands and keeps track of the number of moves.
    Author:
    (Max McEvoy and Maya Vora)

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DOWN  
      static int RIGHT  
      static int totalMovesMade

      Turn​(java.lang.String word, int dir, int startingColumn, int startingRow)
      Initializes the user's input commands into variables to be used in the methods that come later in the class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turn

        public Turn​(java.lang.String word,
            int dir,
            int startingColumn,
            int startingRow)
        Initializes the user's input commands into variables to be used in the methods that come later in the class.
        Parameters:
        word - The word the user desires.
        dir - The direction the user desires when forming their word.
        startingColumn - The column the user desires to start at when forming their word.
        startingRow - The row the user desires to start at when forming their word.

    • Method Detail

      • getStartRow

        public static int getStartRow()
        Displays the starting row
        Returns:
        The row the user entered to start at.

      • getStartCol

        public static int getStartCol()
        Displays the starting column.
        Returns:
        The column the user entered to start at.

      • getUserWord

        public static java.lang.String getUserWord()
        Gets the word the user typed.
        Returns:
        The word that the user entered to be placed on the board.

      • getDirection

        public static int getDirection()
        Gets the direction the user specified.
        Returns:
        The direction that the user entered to be used for placement on the board.

      • movesMadeSoFar

        public static int movesMadeSoFar()
        Keeps track of the total moves made to ensure the first move is on the middle space of the board.
        Returns:
        The number of total moves made.

      • getRealMove

        public boolean getRealMove()
        Getter method that evaluates whether or not the move the player made is valid.
        Returns:
        True if the move is valid and false if it isn't.

      • isMoveValid

        public static void isMoveValid​(Turn turn)
        Checks to make sure the move is actually playable.
        Parameters:
        turn - The turn object representing the move to be validated.
